TITLE: Innovate to Grow Goes Virtual
DESCRIPTION: The School of Engineering is hosting it's annual event Innovate to Grow, which has always been a day-long series of presentations, posters and judging, will be held entirely online this year in a streamlined format via Zoom on May 15.

TITLE: Earth Day Talk Focuses on Ag Land and Water Regulations, Solutions
DESCRIPTION: The Center for Information Technology in the Interest of Society (CITRIS) and UC Mercedâ€™s Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Graduate Group present an online talk for the golden anniversary of Earth Day.

TITLE: CITRIS Seed Funding
DESCRIPTION: Due to the new challenges posed to working schedules and lives by the COVID-19 pandemic, the submission deadline of 2020 Core Seed Funding Program has been changed to this Fall - September 10th, 2020.

TITLE: The Future Machines of Agriculture
DESCRIPTION: A new article, 'The Future of Machines' covers key areas of UC Merced research: Addressing the Drought, Introducing RAPID, Preparing for the Future, Drinking in the Data, Gettng on Board, and On the Road to the Future.

TITLE: UC Merced and Merced College Pair Up to Train Future Tech Researchers
DESCRIPTION: Thirty-four students from San Joaquin Valley colleges are getting an opportunity to learn how to access and build careers in technology and research at a unique workshop designed to help diversify science-related fields.
